title: Chain Snatching Gang – Faridabad
summary: Repeated chain snatching incidents near Neelam Chowk and Badhkal.

stages.info:
3 chain snatching cases reported in 48 hours.
Victims: women returning from markets.
Suspects on black Splendor.
stages.question: What do you do first?
options: Map incidents & check hotspot patterns via Crime Mapping
stages.feedback_wrong: Hotspot mapping helps identify pattern routes.
stages.next_info: Pattern shows suspects using Badhkal–Sec 21 road repeatedly.

stages.info:
Pattern roadway identified.
CCTV available at two chowks.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Obtain CCTV & match riding posture/vehicle features
Ask victims to identify suspects without any photo
stages.feedback_wrong: Posture and vehicle traits help develop leads.
stages.next_info: CCTV shows bike with missing side mirror, partial plate HR51AX.

stages.info:
Partial plate HR51AX.
Shortlist: 6 Splendors in Faridabad.
stages.question: Your response?
options: Verify ownership & check vehicles for modifications
stages.next_info: One owner reports bike stolen a week ago.

stages.info:
Owner says bike stolen.
Bike may be used by snatching gang.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Track bike’s movement using FSL fingerprint on mirrors/handles
stages.feedback_wrong: Stolen bike often holds forensic clues.
stages.next_info: Lifted latent prints match juvenile offender from previous case.

stages.info: Prints match juvenile from 2024 snatching case.
stages.question: Next step?
options: Locate associates & run covert surveillance on known hideouts
stages.feedback_wrong: Surveillance helps catch active gang members.
stages.next_info: Surveillance finds gang preparing for next snatching.

stages.question: Action?
options: Conduct safe apprehension with backup and secure evidence
Let them escape to gather more data
stages.feedback_wrong: Safe apprehension is the correct & legal approach.
